meanings.definition: Descent from a common ancestor; lineage.
meanings.sent1: The royal family's bloodlines can be traced back for centuries.
meanings.sent2: She was proud of her strong bloodlines that connected her to famous historical figures.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed to have royal bloodlines, demanding only the finest treats.
meanings.sent4: In the world of thoroughbred horses, good bloodlines can make all the difference in racing success.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree's roots intertwined, symbolizing the interconnected bloodlines of all living beings.

meanings.definition: A sequence of ancestors or descendants.
meanings.sent1: Studying her family's bloodlines helped her understand her heritage better.
meanings.sent2: The genealogist meticulously documented the bloodlines of the royal family.
meanings.sent3: The bloodlines of the famous artist were so convoluted, it was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The bloodlines of the river flowed through generations, shaping the landscape over time.
meanings.sent5: The bloodlines of the ancient oak tree spread far and wide, connecting the forest in a web of history.
